knownissues: There are some issues (<i=24>) when the Location Bar Puzzle Bar is used together with <e=ui-enhancer>Location Bar Enhancer</e>.

notes: This is the last update! The add-on will stop working by next November with Firefox 57. Click here for more info.

When the add-on is automatically updated, it now shows a less intrusive notification toaster message linking to the release notes; as before, this can still be disabled in the About page in the add-on's preferences
Compatibility with <e=omnisidebar>OmniSidebar</e>, the Lateral Puzzle Bar would interfere with the sidebar docking
Hide unnecessary Slim Chrome related checkbox in the options page for the Top Puzzle Bar when Beyond Australis add-on is not installed
Compatibility with <e=tab-groups-panorama>Tab Groups</e>; groups button would be almost invisible if it was showing the group name instead of the icon
In small windows, the add-on's preferences page could overflow and lose its scrollbars, where some content would be inaccessible
Compatibility with <e=tab-mix-plus>Tab Mix Plus</e>; setting a shortcut to one reserved (but unused) by Tab Mix Plus's session related features at startup wouldn't work
In a few cases (multi-window + e10s + sometimes) the add-on could fail to fully initialize
Tweak the appearance of badged buttons in a Puzzle Toolbar, so that the badge isn't too outside of the button
Labeled buttons in the Location Bar Puzzle Bar were a little off
Try not to blink the <e=tab-groups-panorama>Tab Groups</e> quick access panel when opening it anchored to a button on one of our hidden toolbars (<i=97>)
Make sure dimensions of puzzle bars are updated when the tab groups button shows the name of the current group (<i=98>)
Style the buttons correctly in the location bar puzzle bar with themes that make it dark (<i=93>)
Appearance tweaks for the <e=https-everywhere>HTTPS Everywhere</e> button (<i=93>)
Added MPL license headers to source files
Compatibility with Firefox 44 and below, compatibility with Firefox 45 will be maintained for the duration of the ESR 45 life cycle
(non-e10s) some missing functionality right after updating the add-on until the browser was restarted
After navigating away from the preferences tab, navigating back (through the back button) wouldn't work
(Firefox 47) could fail to detect customize mode during startup
Small memory leak when disabling the add-on (thanks to the8472)
Compatibility with <e=picknsave>Pick & Save Images</e>, its icon would be heavily distorted if placed in the location bar's puzzle bar (<i=88>)
(OSX and Linux) the add-on's preferences would be exported into a file without the ".json" extension that the add-on couldn't immediately recognize afterwards

Added a small section to this page to promote my new web series "A dude and his Firefox"; it will be completely out of your way unless you point at the icon at the bottom corner, and you can dismiss it completely by clicking its close button.
Buttons in the lateral toolbar would not span across the whole toolbar width, often being cropped out of the toolbar
The corner bar's active area slider would reset to the maximum sensitivity when re-opening the preferences tab
Significant improvement to memory usage, as well as to browser startup time and when opening new tabs
Default file name when exporting preferences would have the wrong month
Can use the control key in Mac OSX in the keyboard shortcuts
Added support for the following keys in the keyboard shortcuts: ` Â´ ~ ^
Simplified share icons in about page
Ensure UTF-8 character encoding throughout the code
Small code cleanup - trim trailing whitespaces
Sometimes toggling the ctrl/alt/shift boxes in a keyboard shortcut wouldn't correctly reflect if the selected key was actually available
Toggling Location Bar's Puzzle Bar auto-hide would require a browser restart to take effect
Panels or popups opened from icons in a puzzle bar set to autohide could show some weirdness, like showing only the borders, flashing on screen or even jumping to the top-left edge of the window
Slight performance drop caused by an error in the code

(Firefox 43) Location Bar's Puzzle Bar auto-hide behavior tweaked to accomodate for the new position of the urlbar's dropmarker; mousing over it will keep the icons shown if they were shown already, so that it doesn't move away with the rest of the icons when you want to click it
Don't use eval in any part of the code; should bring a slight performance enhancement when used together with <e=tile-tabs>Tile Tabs</e>
The keyboard shortcut dropdown selectors weren't properly populated only with the available keys
Possible fix for slight appearance issue with badge icons
Tweaked the name ever so slightly to Puzzle Bars (was Puzzle Toolbars)
Code for migrating settings from old versions of the add-on (The Puzzle Piece 1.*)
Minor improvements to multiline string concatenation code, as suggested by AMO reviewer
Share icons in the add-on's About pane
Minor improvements to global add-on and individual toolbar deinitialization speed
Some dynamic menupopups, such as the one opened by <e=noscript>NoScript</e>'s button, could cause the toolbars to get stuck open when set to autohide
(Firefox 44) the add-on would fail to start in the latest Nightly builds
Toolbars wouldn't work properly in fullscreen mode
(Firefox 42+) Badge icons, such as the Hello! button, would appear distorted in the Location Bar Puzzle Bar (<i=82>)
The "Show this tab on the next update" checkbox will be highlighted the first time the About pane is shown on an update, to better mark where future notifications can be easily disabled
The helptext panel in the add-on's preferences would sometimes cover the options on small screens or if the sidebar was open

Compatibility with <e=omnisidebar>OmniSidebar</e> and <e=the-fox-only-better>The Fox, Only Better</e>: the Bookmark This Page button would stop working if one of the add-ons was disabled/updated; this fix requires a browser restart
(Firefox 41+) toolbars would not react correctly when entering or exiting fullscreen
Re-styled and optimized the help tooltips in the preferences
Only request the Development Status information when the About pane in the preferences is accessed
Force LTR layout for the preferences tab options, at least until any RTL locales are included
The preferences, especially the corner active mouse area slider, were very sluggish to change, all should be much smoother now
Lightweight themes (personas) were not being applied to the corner puzzle toolbar (<i=81>)
Brand new preferences tab with a new "About" pane (previously the "Release Notes" tab)
The active development process for the add-on is undergoing a few changes, check out the information and links at the top of this pane for more details
Downloads indicator could not reflect the actual status of current downloads
Don't load the puzzle toolbars in popup windows where they're not supposed to exist
When placing the bookmarks toolbar in any of the puzzle toolbars, it could fail to initialize properly when starting up the browser (<i=80>)
Compatibility with latest version of <e=the-fox-only-better>The Fox, Only Better</e>
Autohiding the lateral puzzle bar in fullscreen could not work with OmniSidebar installed
Some toolbar icons were distorted in the location bar puzzle bar in the latest Nightly (Firefox 40)
Reorganized code and did some cleanup
Release Notes tab URI defaults to about:puzzlebars instead of chrome://..., which is now fully functional in multiprocess firefox (e10s)
The Release Notes link in the preferences dialog would sometimes fail to work
Compatibility with <e=tree-style-tab>Tree Style Tab</e>'s autohide tabs toolbar feature, corner puzzle toolbar would not be properly positioned
<e=stylish>Stylish</e> button would be a few pixels too wide for its icon when placed in the Location Bar Puzzle Bar
<e=show-anchors-2>Show Anchors 2</e> button (and possibly others) could not have the hover style applied when hovered
The corner bar's puzzle piece would occlude the bottom toolbar when set to autohide
Compatibility fixes for FoxyProxy Standard and FoxyProxy Basic add-ons introduced in the last update, they're no longed needed since their latest versions are already fully compatible
Compatibility with Tree Style Tab add-on, toggling the lateral bar would leave the vertical tabs wrongly positioned
Prevent some visual glitches during startup
Location bar puzzle bar wouldn't appear in Customize Mode sometimes
Improved compatibility with my other add-ons, if you use any of them make sure they are also updated and restart your browser afterwards
Compatibility with <e=quickjava>Quick Java</e>, it's icons would be misproportioned when placed in any puzzle toolbar
If more than one window is open, toggling a toolbar in one window wouldn't correctly update its puzzle piece in other windows (<i=62>)
Toolbars wouldn't be properly sized/positioned when resizing the window in e10s
Compatibility with <e=omnisidebar>OmniSidebar</e>, the lateral puzzle bar should work in perfect harmony with the sidebar in all modes
Fixed several issues when placing the Bookmarks Toolbar Items in any of the puzzle toolbars
Hello button in location bar puzzle bar was squished (probably other badge-type widgets as well)
Compatibility with <e=foxyproxy-standard>FoxyProxy Standard</e> and <e=foxyproxy-basic>FoxyProxy Basic</e>, their toolbar icons wouldn't change state after a restart when placed in a puzzle toolbar
Name! "The Puzzle Piece" changed to "Puzzle Toolbars"
Can enable all different toolbar methods simultaneously
Open the release notes tab when the add-on updates
Support < (less than) and > (greater than) characters in the keyboard shortcut
The puzzle bar in the location bar can optionally automatically hide only when the cursor is in the location bar (<i=30>)
Added version information to the top of the window DOM tree, for better compatibility with themes
Corner toolbar can be extended to cover all the available window width
Bottom toolbar now has its own overflow panel
The area in the corner reactive to the mouse to show the toolbar can be customized (larger area = easier to show the toolbar when it's autohiding) (<i=40>)
Improved display and handling of toolbar separators
Status bar is now movable; to use it just drag it from the customize dialog into any toolbar
Puzzle piece icon in corner toolbar also shrinks when not hovered, just like the others
When using dark themes (personas), the buttons hover effects are now white-ish for a better contrast (<i=42>)
Ability to use flexible spaces in the menu panel
No longer migrate the items from the navigation bar (old add-on bar) and from Classic Theme Restorer's add-on bar to ours, as it no longer makes sense to do it
zh-CN locale, at least temporarily, it was too severely outdated to be usable in the new version
Allow using separators and spacers in the menu panel
Enhanced compatibility with my other add-ons
Enhanced compatibility with other add-ons that also have a "restore status bar" feature when ours is disabled (may require a browser restart)
Corner puzzle bar wouldn't be properly styled when previewing themes (personas) (<i=38>)
Buttons would be shown outside of the toolbar in customize mode (<i=50>)
Add-on could sometimes not deinitialize properly
Opening the toolbar in the location bar would happen immediately sometimes, without the transition animation
In Firefox 34 and above, the toolbars opened/closed state wouldn't be remembered between sessions
Bookmarks star button would not initialize properly on startup in any puzzle toolbar
Some menus and panels, like the bookmarked item panel, would not force the toolbars to stay visible if autohide was enabled
Compatibility with <e=cookiesafe-ff-4-compatible>CookieSafe</e>, its button would appear distored in any puzzle toolbar
Toolbars should hide when in fullscreen and the native firefox option "Hide Toolbars" is enabled (Windows and Linux) (<i=46>)
Compatibility with <e=hide-caption-titlebar-plus-sma>Hide Caption Titlebar Plus</e>, mousing over its movable tab title elements would not keep the toolbars visible when autohiding was enabled
Compatibility with <e=tab-mix-plus>Tab Mix Plus</e> tabs on bottom feature, the bottom puzzle piece would be inaccessible
Many other minor fixes and improvements
Sometimes switching between tabs with the find bar open, the add-on bar would be left floating in mid air
Many appearance tweaks for buttons in the add-on bar
Clicking "Restore defaults" in customize mode shouldn't collapse the add-on bar (much less leave a Puzzle Piece hanging alone in the corner)
Some buttons appear too wide in the location bar (SDK add-ons and Tab Utilities)
All the buttons in the add-on bar in the corner should be properly aligned and the same height (whenever possible)
Zoom control wouldn't show current zoom level text
Tweaked slightly the search bar in the add-on bar so it fits there better
Get rid of some annoying (but harmless) messages in the console
Compatibility with the latest versions of the Classic Theme Restorer add-on
Compatibility with Clickless Menu add-on, and possibly others: TPP failed to initialize and the customization area would be empty
Compatibility with Location Bar Enhancer add-on together with positioning the add-on bar in the location bar; this isn't perfect but it's the best I could do from my side
Tweaked styling of buttons with dropmarkers a bit when add-on bar is moved to the location bar
Some changes to the add-on bar (dynamic showing/hiding of buttons) would not update its width when it was moved to the location bar
Compatibility with Tile Tabs: if setting add-on bar keyboard shortcut to the same shortcut as one of the TT's function keys, the add-on bar shortcut wouldn't work after a restart
The Puzzle Piece icon in the corner would be clipped too quickly if the add-on bar was closed and autohide was enabled
Important note! If you're updating from a previous version, you may have to restart your browser for the update to fully take effect.
(Australis) should no longer close the customize dialog by itself every now and then
(Australis) better handling when entering/exiting customize mode
(Australis) customize context menu entries shouldn't be enabled when right clicking the PanelUI button or the overflow button
(Australis) customize context menu entries in the menu panel would sometimes be wrongly disabled
(Australis) the add-on bar shouldn't hide automatically if a panel from a widget in it is open
Compatibility with Tree Style Tab add-on
Placing the downloads indicator in the add-on bar in the corner would not show it correctly
The add-on bar would auto-hide when opening the downloads panel from it
(Australis) zombie compartment would remain after disabling the add-on
Add-on could fail to (re)load after disabling/updating one of my other add-ons
When placed in the corner, the puzzle piece icon could hide faster than the add-on bar sometimes
Sometimes when starting firefox, the add-on bar would get stuck open if it was set to auto-hide (if this still happens to anyone please let me know!)
Can also hide the Puzzle Piece toggle button in the location bar (won't automatically hide in this case)
(Australis) customize context menu entries to add and remove widgets to and from the add-on bar
Can hide the Puzzle Piece toggle button from the add-on bar
When the add-on bar is placed on the bottom, the Puzzle Piece icon shrinks, so it doesn't cover any webpage content
(Australis) support lightweight themes (personas) when the add-on bar is in the corner
The green puzzle piece icon would sometimes cover the add-on bar's content
(Australis) not working when opening a new window
(Australis) toolbar separators were not appearing in the menu panel in the latest builds
(Australis) toolbar spacers and separators were not appearing in the nav-bar's overflow panel in the latest builds
(Australis) all widgets in the customize palette were distorted
Compatibility with Tile Tabs add-on: status text would be shown behind the add-on bar when placed in the corner
(Australis) the latest builds displays the separators and flexible spaces incorrectly in the menu panel while customizing
(Australis) after restarting from safe mode to a normal session, you would lose the customization state of the add-on bar
(Australis) fixed add-on bar color in Windows 8 when in the color (and probably better integration with some themes as well)
(Australis) status bar would fail to appear in new windows or would disappear from previous windows when opening new windows
(Australis) sometimes the add-on bar, when positioned in the corner, would not be placed correctly after exiting customize mode
(Australis) positioning the add-on bar in the location bar and doing "Remove from Toolbar" on any of its widgets would leave empty spaces
When the add-on bar was placed in the location bar, it would be hidden instantaneously when toggling its placement or when exiting customize mode
The toolbar context menu would stutter a moment when opening sometimes
Addressed a comment from the last version's AMO review
Sometimes the green puzzle piece icon would appear behind the add-on bar when it was in the corner of the screen
(Australis) toggling the add-on bar while in customize mode would make the puzzle piece get stuck
Compatibility with S3. Download Statusbar add-on: place the add-on bar correctly when moving the S3 bar

(Australis) compatibility with latest Classic Theme Restorer add-on: double separators/spacers/springs in customization palette; automatically migrate widgets added to CTR's add-on bar to TPP's add-on bar; compatibility with CTR's new "Restore status bar" feature

(Australis) compatibility with latest Nightly and Aurora builds: failing to uninitialize properly; special icons in the palette wrongly displayed; place the add-on bar together with the rest of the UI when in customizing
Minor appearance fixes for latest Nightly
Restore the add-on bar in the new Australis theme! It should automatically restore most of the current items in your add-on bar when you update your firefox
Fully compatible with the Classic Theme Restorer add-on
Restore the separator/space/flexible space items in the customization dialog
Option to restore the status bar into the add-on bar as well
Add version information to about tab in the preferences dialog
The link in the About tab (in TPP's preferences) to the AMO page would not be built correctly sometimes
Installing the add-on could fail the first try
Disabling the add-on could fail causing memory issues
Compatibility with Firefox 25: findbar would be behind the add-on bar
Add-on bar shouldn't be visible when content is shown fullscreen
When autohiding, the puzzle piece could get stuck in the corner when disabling or updating another of my add-ons
On Max OS, disabling the add-on would cause the add-on bar to disappear
Add-on bar and find bar borders had a wrong color
Replaced some old deprecated methods with new ones
Window elements would jump around for a moment during startup
Add-on bar could be cut off when its content changed and after startup
High CPU rate in add-on manager when add-on bar is in the location bar
Add-on bar height incorrect in small windows sometimes
